bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas, April 1, 1952

div1.p: Hench writes that he is glad Rojas will permit Rath to visit the Finca San Jose to offer advice on preservation.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas, April 1, 1952
div1.opener:
April 1, 1952
Senora Maria Teresa Rojas
Finca San Jose
Calzada Real y Gomez Redencion
Quemados de Marianao
Havana, Cuba
My dear Tina:
div1.p:
Thank you for your very interesting letter of March 22. I shall cer-
tainly hope that when things become stabilized you will find that the
situation has improved. There was certainly room for improvement,
wasn't there?

I have written today to Mr. Rath, transmitting to him your kind in-
vitation to visit you and be your house guest. He is a very charming
young man and will, I know, help you in any way possible. I am sure
that he (as I do) will consider it a privilege to be your guest at
the lovely finca. I don't know how long he can stay. That, of course,
is up to you and him but I hope he can stay at least a couple of days
so as to get a well-rounded picture of the situation.

Do not be unduly concerned if Mr. Rath's initial advice or help seems
to be incomplete. I am sure that the three of us, you and he and I,
as time passes will get some good ideas and remember that I am determined
to keep on with this venture and when I get determined, I can be very
determined.
Our very best also to Lydia and your cousin, Julia.
div1.closer: Affectionately yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
